meanings.definition: Toward or in the direction of the coast.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed coastward to reach the sandy shore.
meanings.sent2: We drove coastward along the scenic route by the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The seagull flew coastward, eager to dip its wings in the salty water.
meanings.sent4: The sun set coastward, painting the sky with hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The children ran coastward, excited to build sandcastles on the beach.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing toward the coast.
meanings.sent1: The coastward breeze carried the scent of salt and seaweed.
meanings.sent2: The coastward view from the cliff was breathtakingly beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The coastward trees leaned slightly as if trying to catch a glimpse of the sea.
meanings.sent4: The coastward houses seemed to embrace the ocean with their open windows.
meanings.sent5: The coastward journey was filled with anticipation and wonder.
